TOW Missile Launcher.name: TOW Missile Launcher
TOW Missile Launcher.description:
@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02heavyweaponh00]{Heavy Weapon}. A wire-guided missile fired from a portable or vehicle-mounted launcher. Doesn’t require a lock—just a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll, and can’t be jammed. @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Area Effect Attacks]{Medium Blast Template}.

Unless otherwise noted, missiles must “lock” onto their targets before they can be fired. This action is an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Electronics]{Electronics} roll versus the target’s maneuvering skill (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Boating]{Boating}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Driving]{Driving}, or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Piloting]{Piloting}, as appropriate). Success gives the attacker a “short” lock and allows him to fire up to half the missiles his particular craft can fire at once. A raise is a more solid lock and allows him to fire all of them.

The enemy attempts to evade each missile separately by making a maneuvering roll at −4 (or −2 if the target has substantial cover to hide behind—such as asteroids, skyscrapers, canyon walls, or even large enemy ships. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{Critical Failure} means the craft goes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.Out of Control]{Out of Control}.

Anti-Missile Systems: Warships and futuristic space vessels often have “point defense” systems to shoot down incoming missiles. Operators must be on @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03hold0000000000]{Hold} to shoot down missiles; automated systems attack automatically. The system grants a single @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll per missile at Short @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} and any other relevant modifiers (including @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03speed000000000]{Speed}—missiles move at Mach 1, a −6 penalty, unless otherwise noted). Unless otherwise noted, missiles are objects with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Breaking Things]{Toughness} of 8 (2).
TOW Missile Launcher.notes: Heavy Weapon. A wire-guided missile fired from a portable or vehicle-mounted launcher. Doesn’t require a lock—just a Shooting roll, and can’t be jammed.

Bouncing Betty.name: Bouncing Betty
Bouncing Betty.description:
These deadly anti-personnel mines are designed to pop up into the air and rain shrapnel down from about head-height. Only full overhead cover offers an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armor000000000]{Armor} bonus against such devices. Simply being prone offers no protection from these deadly explosives. Use a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Small Blast Template}.

Mines are explosives planted beneath shallow dirt that detonate in the listed blast template (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Area Effect Attacks}) when a person (for anti-personnel mines) or vehicle (for anti-tank mines) passes over them.

Minefields: For dramatic purposes, a character who steps on a mine should get a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} roll. Success means she realizes it before stepping off and detonating it. Saving the victim requires a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Repair]{Repair} roll at −4, but failure detonates the device immediately.
Bouncing Betty.notes: These deadly anti-personnel mines are designed to pop up into the air and rain shrapnel down from about head-height. Only full overhead cover offers an Armor bonus against such devices. Simply being prone offers no protection from these deadly explosives.

Flamethrower.description:

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armor000000000]{Armor} protects normally, but flammable targets may @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04fire0000000000]{catch fire}.

For vehicular flamethrowers, see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-special-weapons.Heavy Flamethrower]{Heavy Flamethrower}.

Sidewinder.name: Sidewinder
Sidewinder.description:
@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Heavy Weapon (HW)]{Heavy Weapon}. A short range, heat-seeking missile fired from an aircraft. @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Small Blast Template}.

Unless otherwise noted, missiles must “lock” onto their targets before they can be fired. This action is an opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Electronics]{Electronics} roll versus the target’s maneuvering skill (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Boating]{Boating}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Driving]{Driving}, or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Piloting]{Piloting}, as appropriate). Success gives the attacker a “short” lock and allows him to fire up to half the missiles his particular craft can fire at once. A raise is a more solid lock and allows him to fire all of them.

The enemy attempts to evade each missile separately by making a maneuvering roll at −4 (or −2 if the target has substantial cover to hide behind—such as asteroids, skyscrapers, canyon walls, or even large enemy ships. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{Critical Failure} means the craft goes @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.Out of Control]{Out of Control}.

Anti-Missile Systems: Warships and futuristic space vessels often have “point defense” systems to shoot down incoming missiles. Operators must be on @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03hold0000000000]{Hold} to shoot down missiles; automated systems attack automatically. The system grants a single @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll per missile at Short @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} and any other relevant modifiers (including @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03speed000000000]{Speed}—missiles move at Mach 1, a −6 penalty, unless otherwise noted). Unless otherwise noted, missiles are objects with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Breaking Things]{Toughness} of 8 (2).
Sidewinder.notes: Heavy Weapon. A short range, heat-seeking missile fired from an aircraft.
